title: Golden Set & Evals: How to Know Your Agent Works
intent: Learn how to evaluate agents systematically so improvements do not break existing behavior.

core_idea.one_liner: If you cannot measure agent quality, you cannot improve it.
why_it_matters: Agents regress silently after prompt or knowledge changes.
Evaluation turns agent development into engineering.

definition.golden_set: A curated set of representative questions and tasks with expected outcomes used for repeatable evaluation.
definition.eval: A process that compares agent outputs against expectations using clear criteria.

eval_dimensions.question: Is the answer factually and logically correct?
Are claims supported by retrieved knowledge or tools?
Would a real user consider this helpful?
Is the quality acceptable for the time and cost?

eval_patterns.description: Run the agent against the golden set after any change.
Ensure old correct answers stay correct.
Test a new version in parallel without affecting users.

golden_case.input: Replication delayed for only one business partner type
golden_case.expected: Agent asks for object-specific filters and mapping checks
golden_case.failure_signal: Agent suggests generic system performance issues

failure_modes: Golden set too small or too clean
Ignoring eval failures under time pressure
guards: Every agent change must run evals.
Eval results must be stored and compared over time.

teach_it_in_english.simple_explanation: A golden set is a test exam your agent must pass every time.
teach_it_in_english.one_sentence_definition: Evals turn agent behavior into something you can trust.

practical_checklist: Do we have representative test cases?
